oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SUSPENDED SEDIMENT MIXING IN THE SURF ZONE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jimenez, Jose A.
Rivero, Francisco J.
Sanchez-Arcilla, Agustin
Gracia, Vicente
Rodriguez, Andres
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surf zone
sediment mixing
suspended sediment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The vertical distribution of suspended sediment in the surf zone is analysed by using field measurements. The analysis focuses in the description of the shape of the profile, i.e. mixing coefficient, and to do this, several approaches have been followed: pure diffusion, pure convection and combined diffusion-convection. The obtained results show a strong dependence of the sediment diffusion coefficient with the sediment grain size whereas the convective length scale presented a smaller grain-size influence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
